body: btw I'm not sure this should be possible, it seems like the impl would be unconstrained?

@ebfull I believe it depends on a method. If there was an `fn foo(&self) {}` there, and you'd try to call it, Rust wouldn't understand what implementation it belongs to. But with `present()` the `D` type is constrained, thus leaving no questions for the `impl` block.

It sounds like you might also want to consider just `impl<T: Device> Foo<T>` and `fn present(&self, _dev: &T::Resources)` if you want `present` to be called with only one particular `T: Device` type per impl. (But I don't know your API requirements.)
